data.name: ADC data formatting
data.description:
You going to make some voltmeters and use different analog-digital converters (ADCs) to measure voltage.
You have different models of ADCs with resolution 6...16 bits and reference voltages 0-12 V.

The conversion result is stored in 2 bytes: most significant and least significant byte (if resolution is 8 or less bits, msbyte = 0):
```C
|X|X|X|X|X|X|X|X| |X|X|X|X|X|X|X|X|
      msbyte           lsbyte        
```
You want to make a function that takes result of conversion (2 data bytes - msbyte, lsbyte), reference voltage (vref) and resolution of ADC and returns measured voltage. Something like this:
```C
code_to_voltage(2, 255, 5, 12) => 0.936
``` 
*Some explanations:*
For example, 3-bit ADC has 2^3 = 8 voltage 'levels' it can measure.
The digital codes of this levels will be 000, 001, 010 ... 111 in binary form. 

If reference voltage (vref) is 5 V, ADC can measure voltage in range 0...5 V with step 5/8 V = 0.625 V.

If measured voltage is 2.5 V (the half of vref), the data in lsbyte = 100_2 = 4_10.
![conversion](https://www.edn.com/wp-content/uploads/media-1050787-c0306-figure1.gif)
